title.value: Online Interior-point Methods for Time-Varying Equality-constrained Optimization
title.justification: This is the title presented at the beginning of the research paper.
title.quote: Online Interior-point Methods for Time-Varying Equality-constrained Optimization

extractions.description: This paper presents a projection-free algorithm for online convex optimization (OCO) with time-varying equality and generalized inequality constraints, named OIPM-TEC. Additionally, it introduces an alternative algorithm, epsilon-OIPM-TEC, with a focus on epsilon-regret for more computationally efficient performance assessments. The efficacy of these algorithms is illustrated through an online optimal power flow (OPF) problem in electric grids.

type.justification: The paper proposes new algorithms (OIPM-TEC and epsilon-OIPM-TEC) and showcases their performance through practical experiments on an online OPF problem.
type.quote: Finally, we showcase the performance of these two algorithms on an online OPF problem and compare them to another OCO algorithm from the literature.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on developing and assessing new optimization algorithms for time-varying equality-constrained problems.
name.quote: An important challenge in the online convex optimization (OCO) setting is to incorporate generalized inequalities and time-varying constraints.

name.justification: The paper's algorithms are designed within the online convex optimization framework.
name.quote: An important challenge in the online convex optimization (OCO) setting is to incorporate generalized inequalities and time-varying constraints.

name.justification: The effectiveness of the proposed algorithms (OIPM-TEC and epsilon-OIPM-TEC) is demonstrated on an online optimal power flow problem.
name.quote: Finally, we showcase the performance of these two algorithms on an online OPF problem and compare them to another OCO algorithm from the literature.

name.justification: The primary algorithm proposed in the paper for online convex optimization with time-varying equality and generalized inequality constraints.
name.quote: In this work, we propose the first projection-free OCO algorithm admitting time-varying linear constraints and convex generalized inequalities: the online interior-point method for time-varying equality constraints (OIPM-TEC).

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces OIPM-TEC as a novel contribution for time-varying equality-constrained OCO problems.
is_contributed.quote: We present the first projection-free OCO algorithm that admits convex generalized inequalities and time-varying linear equality constraints while achieving tight sublinear dynamic regret and constraint violation bounds.

is_executed.justification: The algorithm was executed as part of the empirical evaluation in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We illustrate the performance of our approaches by solving an online OPF based on the 33-bus Matpower case.

is_compared.justification: The performance of OIPM-TEC was compared against other OCO algorithms in the literature.
is_compared.quote: Finally, we showcase the performance of these two algorithms on an online OPF problem and compare them to another OCO algorithm from the literature.

referenced_paper_title.justification: As a newly proposed model in this paper, there is no previous reference paper for OIPM-TEC.

name.justification: An alternative version of OIPM-TEC introduced in the paper, focusing on epsilon-regret for more computational efficiency.
name.quote: For applications where a given tolerance around optima is accepted, we employ an alternative OCO performance metric – the epsilon-regret – and a more computationally efficient algorithm, the epsilon-OIPM-TEC, that possesses sublinear bounds under this metric.

is_contributed.justification: epsilon-OIPM-TEC is introduced in the paper as a novel approach for handling epsilon-regret in time-varying equality-constrained OCO problems.
is_contributed.quote: For applications where a given tolerance around optima is accepted, we employ an alternative OCO performance metric – the epsilon-regret – and a more computationally efficient algorithm, the epsilon-OIPM-TEC.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes empirical evaluation of the epsilon-OIPM-TEC algorithm.
is_executed.quote: We illustrate the performance of our approaches by solving an online OPF based on the 33-bus Matpower case.

is_compared.justification: epsilon-OIPM-TEC's performance was compared with that of other OCO algorithms from existing literature.
is_compared.quote: We illustrate the performance of our approaches by solving an online OPF based on the 33-bus Matpower case.

referenced_paper_title.justification: As a novel algorithm proposed within this paper, there is no pre-existing referenced paper for epsilon-OIPM-TEC.
